etymology.description: semantic: 目(目) (mù, "eye") provides idea of observing or inspecting + phonetic: 禹(禹) (yǔ) suggests pronunciation = tool or implement -> something for inspection or use
etymology.interpretation: The character 常(常) (cháng, "often") conveys the sense of being equipped or complete, integrating both observation (目) and utility (from 万). This association makes intuitive sense for a character that means 'tool' or 'implement' as it suggests both functionality and the ability to execute tasks.

parts.english: name of an ancient Chinese ruler

examples.chinese: 工匠使用精致的具打造艺术品(工匠使用精緻的具打造藝術品)。
examples.pinyin: Gōngjiàng shǐyòng jīngzhì de jù dǎzào yìshùpǐn.
examples.english: The craftsman uses exquisite implements to create art pieces.

examples.chinese: 他把新具收纳在工具箱里(他把新具收納在工具箱裏)，以便随时使用(以便隨時使用)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bǎ xīn jù shōunà zài gōngjùxiāng lǐ, yǐbiàn suíshí shǐyòng.
examples.english: He stores the new tool in the toolbox, so that it is available for use at any time.
